moves.1. e4: Hello everybody - this is a game I played against hiredgun112. Hope you enjoy.
moves.2... Nf6:
Still normal, but there is a trap which goes:

3. Nxe5 Nxe4 4. Qe2 Nf6 5. Nc6+ winning queen.
moves.3... a6: Why not defend the e5 pawn? People like to play a6 and h6 often, but there is often no point in it.
moves.4. Bc4: Developing, though I could just take the e-pawn.
moves.6. Nxe5: Now that my development is set up, I take the e-pawn.
moves.6... d6: Opening lines for the bishop and attacking my knight.
moves.8. h3: It is suitable here to play a wing pawn; this attacks the bishop.
moves.8... Nc6: Ignoring this and developing the knight.
moves.10. d4: Controlling the centre and attacking the bishop.
moves.10... Qf6: Ignoring the threat of the bishop.
moves.11... Qh6: And he immediately resigns after playing this move. The queen will get taken by the bishop on c1. Please rate and give comments if necessary. Thank you.
